metadata.synopsis: The morning after the climax of the game - Avatar Astarion has defeated the Netherbrain and is now in a room in the Elfsong Tavern, thinking about what comes next.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *You come to slowly, the events of recent days drifting back in fragments, like a half-remembered dream.*

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Your mind is quiet, finally free of the parasite's control, but your body is thrumming with power.*

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *Power that is now fully unleashed and yours to command. All you have to do is decide what you're doing with it.*

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Well, obviously I'm going to rule Baldur's Gate. What else?

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *You picture the city, its politics and power structures, its beating heart. It would be so easy to bite into it and make it your own.*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Not to rule as a tyrant, of course. You don't need a throne - you can rule quietly from the shadows.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Although... you wouldn't say 'no' to a throne. But not yet.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *There's no need to rush things after all - you have an eternity to play with. And you're going to have some fun.*
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I should start creating my own vampire spawn. I'll need the help to subjugate Baldur's Gate.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *With all of Baldur's Gate to choose from, your servants could be the cream of the crop. Although...*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *You have met some very powerful people recently - even called some of them friends. Perhaps they could be... convinced?*
36.context: NodeContext: "...convinced?" You're more than happy to turn them into vampires by force if you need to

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *You smile as your mind turns over one possibility after another, each scheme more devious and bloody than the last.*

45.speaker: Player
45.text: My companions have grown strong. Perhaps a purge is in order, before they become a threat...

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *If they can destroy the Netherbrain, perhaps they'll think they can destroy the Vampire Ascendant.*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *And now that Shadowheart has the ear of her god... yes, perhaps it's best if they were removed from the equation.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *And Wyll as the Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate? Well that's just ridiculous - he'll have to go.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *Especially when one of them is the Blade of Avernus. Yes, he'll have to go.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *As you run through an ever-growing list of potential enemies, you smile quietly to yourself.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *The future is going to be very, very dangerous. And an awful lot of fun.*
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *Yes, perhaps it is best if they were... removed from the equation.*

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Perhaps I'll see what else this world has to offer.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *There's enough out there that it would take a thousand lifetimes to see it all. Thankfully, you may have a thousand lifetimes to spare.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Your mind is finally quiet, free of the parasite. You revel in a moment's peace before an old tension starts to rise in your chest.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Somewhere in this city, your old master is lurking, waiting to reassert his control over you.*

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *He might wait days or years, but he will come for you. Your reckoning is inevitable.*

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Let him come. I have powerful friends.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *If you've proved nothing else recently, it's that together you can achieve the impossible.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Especially if you have Shar's right hand on your side.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Especially if you have the Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate on your side.*

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *The future seems... well, not 'bright', but certainly not as dark as it could be.*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Especially if you have the Blade of Avernus on your side.*

62.speaker: Player
62.text: If I can beat a Netherbrain, I can kill one vampire.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *And who's to say that if you faced him, you wouldn't still be able to resist? If all this has taught you nothing else, it's that anything is possible.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Who knows, you might even make a habit of it? You could see yourself as a famous slayer of vampires - a freer of spawn.*

9.speaker: Player
9.text: It's a big world out there. He can't control me if he can't find me.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *The Sword Coast alone has a hundred places you could disappear, never mind the vast lands to the east.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *There's an almost endless world for you to explore. Even if you can only see it at night.*

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I wonder if the Gur are still open to working together...

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *You consider the fate of their children once they fell into Cazador's grasp...*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *No. No, you doubt they'll want to do you any favours.*

40.speaker: Player
40.text: If only the Gur weren't all dead. Maybe they could have helped.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Well, what's done is done. This is hardly the time for regrets.*

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *Perhaps it's best to just lie low for a while. Go out and see the world, maybe?*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *There will be dangers aplenty, of course, but what's life without a little danger?*
72.context: NodeContext: Ending with relish in your voice. Danger is FUN after all.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: That's a problem for another day.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *Your mind is quiet, free from the parasite and Cazador both. You're not sure you've ever known peace like it.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *But like everything, there was a cost.*

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *You can feel it in the pit of your stomach - the knowledge you'll never feel the warm sun on your skin again.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Still, you are free. Your future is finally your own. Now you just have to decide what to do with it.*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Being a hero suits me, maybe I'll stick with it. For now.

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *Astarion - Hero of Baldur's Gate. You rather like the sound of that.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *A hero's life won't be an easy one, of course. You'll have to face down every beast, fiend, and lunatic out there, all while dodging assassination attempts, plots, and intrigue.*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Your life will be nothing but one night of peril after another - a bloody cascade of violence that will leave a trail of bodies everywhere you go.*

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I could always join my siblings in the Underdark.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *Perhaps, although who knows how warm your welcome will be after you killed all those spawn in the cells...*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Perhaps, although who knows how warm your welcome will be after you left all those spawn to rot in the cells...*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Still, they're family. You're sure they'll come around.*

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I could always check in on the spawn in the Underdark. All 7,000 of them...

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *You think of the thousands of souls down waiting in the Underdark. Lost, leaderless...*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *You led so many of them into the dark. Who's to say you're not the one to lead them back to the light?*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *Whether you settle in the Underdark or find somewhere more fitting, you're sure the future won't be easy.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *You'll have to feed, move through the world relying on your wits, and avoid the many people who'll want to kill you. It will be very, very dangerous.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *'Yes,' you think to yourself. 'This is going to be fun.'*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Who says I'll never walk in the sun again? There may still be a way, if I can find it.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Being able to walk into the sun is a nice idea, but clearly impossible.*

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *Then again, you've done the impossible half a dozen times recently. Who's to say you don't have one last miracle left in you?*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *'Yes,' you think. Your answer is out there somewhere. And you're going to have fun finding it.*
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion breaks into a big, fangy smile.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I could travel - see the world.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *All these years alive and you have spent almost all of them trapped in the same wretched palace.*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *Yes, you'd rather like to see what else the world has to offer.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *You'll have to see it after dark, of course - when murder, theft, and all manner of lust and debauchery rule the night.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *But of course, you wouldn't have it any other way.*
